intro: Pimpinella moelleri, commonly known as the slender cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the western United States and grows in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with finely toothed edges, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Pimpinella moelleri is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
